intro: Cayratia coi, commonly known as the Chinese maypole vine, is a climbing plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, twining stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, followed by small, round berries. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated as a decorative vine in gardens.
